iati-activity.title: Macaulay Land Use Research Institute:Janeemo Enterprises
iati-activity.description: The JANEEMO project operates in the Chikwawa district (southern Malawi) and uses a combination of three trees (Jatropha, Neem and Moringa) grown on field margins and around homesteads. It has successfully developed renewable sources of energy (biodiesel, biogas and firewood) and provided new income streams through the production and sale of leaf powder. This new project will help current and new JANEEMO farmers to become more productive and better able to add value to their products. They will be linked to prospective markets and assisted to engage effectively with national programmes and institutions which have a direct mandate to support small enterprises. This will improve their ability to influence the terms of trade to ensure that their families and communities benefit from the increase. They will have more secure incomes through a number of activities such as vocational training, and developing and promoting land management standards. The project will also assist in identifying potential products for domestic and export markets and will work towards registering the JANEEMO trading company as a Fairtrade organisation. The links with other Scottish Government funded projects (Mary's Meals and Imani Enterprises) will result in a greater impact of Scottish Government resources across a number of sectors.

contact-info.mailing-address: General Enquiries, St. Andrew's House, Regent Road, Edinburgh, EH1 3DG, Scotland

transaction.description: Total commitment to project end date
